intro: Borreria perrottetii, commonly known as the Mexican redroot, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open woodlands. Borreria perrottetii is a perennial herb that is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
